page.title: 12Flowers of the Guyzance Area
page.content: In the deciduous woodland the first flower of Spring is the snowdrop.This is followed by the primrose,wood sorrel,lesser celandine,wood anmone,bluebell and greater stitchwort As the canopy of new leaves shades the woodland floor these flowers turn to seed and prepare for the following year.The hedges,though casting shadows, do not completely shade their surroundings.In mid-summer hedge woundwort,red campion,meadowsweet, stinging nettle,herb robert,creeping thistle and various umbellifers are common on hedge-banks.Tufted vetch, cleavers,honeysuckle and bramble climb up the hedge sometimes almost obscuring the hawthorn from view.On the disused railway line poppy, forgetnot,meadow cranesbill and rosebay willowherb are swift to colonise.
